alert.note: Alert for Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 01 at 9:32PM AKST until March 02 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Visibility reduced to one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 45 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility and wind chills will improve Thursday morning as winds diminish.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
